title: Holiday Inn-owner IHG reports drop in quarterly revenue per room
text:
FILE PHOTO: The ticker symbol and company logo for InterContinental Hotels Group is displayed on a screen on the floor of the NYSE in New York Reuters

(Reuters) - InterContinental Hotels Group <IHG.L> reported a 0.8% decline in revenue per room for the third quarter on Friday, as the Holiday Inn-owner was hurt by protests in Hong Kong and tougher trading conditions in the United States and China.

The company, which has nearly 5,800 hotels under brand names like Crowne Plaza and Regent Hotels & Resorts, said revenue per available room (RevPAR) fell 6.1% in Greater China, with a 36% drop in Hong Kong.

(Reporting by Tanishaa Nadkar and Uday Sampath in Bengaluru; Editing by Amy Caren Daniel)
description: (Reuters) - InterContinental Hotels Group <IHG.L> reported a 0.8% decline in revenue per room for the third quarter on Friday, as the Holiday Inn-owner was hurt by protests in Hong Kong and tougher trading conditions in the United States and China.
